newsitem.title: CHINA: Zhejiang Expressway mulls road investment.
newsitem.headline: Zhejiang Expressway mulls road investment.

text.p: Chinese toll road operator Zhejiang Expressway Co Ltd said it was in talks to invest in road construction and toll collection projects.

"Following a successful listing, the main task is to ensure an appropriate application of the raised funds which involves the construction of Jiaxing Section of the Shanghai-Hangzhou Expressway and finacing the investment of new projects," Zhejiang Expressway said in an earnings statement on Monday.

The company said it was in discussion to invest in the construction of the 35-kilometre Huzhou section of the Hangzhou-Nanjing Expresswway and to purchase toll collection rights of the Huzhou section of National Road 104.
"The discussion is expected to be concluded soon and construction is expected to commence by September," it said.
The company also said it was considering an investment in the Shangyu-Sanmen Road if a feasibility study of the investment showed a rate of return of more than 20 percent.
Zhejiang Expressway, listed in May 1997, posted profit of 99.85 million yuan for the year ended in December 1996.

Zhejiang Expressway, representing the Zhejiang provincial government's main vehicle for expressway development, operates the Zhejiang section of the Shanghai-Hangzhou-Ningbo Expressway. Its shares eased HK$0.075 to HK$2.225 at midday on Monday.
